intro: Sterigmostemum longistylum, commonly known as the long-stemmed starflower, is a member of the Onagraceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, often branching stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in the spring and attract various pollinators like bees and flies.
